abstract: Scientific objectives and observational requirements relative to sea ice studies in the 1990's are discussed. The development of coupled ice-ocean-atmosphere models that provide information comparable to real data sets through interactive processes is discussed. A series of particular problems that would provide the basis for such a verification data set and which is amenable to satellite systems available or realizable over the next 20 years is presented.
title: Sea Ice

publications.publicationName: Earth Observing System. Vol. 1, pt. 2: Sci. and Mission Requirements

related.title: Earth Observing System.  Volume 1, Part 2:  Science and Mission Requirements.  Working Group Report Appendix
